H0.text: Conglomerate rock is a rock made of material that has settled to the bottom of lakes and oceans and been compressed and hardened.

H1.text: Volcanic rock is rock that is made of material that has settled to the bottom of lakes and oceans and been compressed and hardened.

H2.text: Sedimentary rock is a rock that is made of material that has settled to the bottom of lakes and oceans and has been compressed and hardened.

H3.text: Metamorphic rock is rock that is made of material that has settled to the bottom of lakes and oceans and has been compressed and hardened.

A4.text: Sedimentary rocks are formed by the accumulation of particles at Earth's surface, transported by water, wind, ice, or mass movement, and deposited in layers.

A5.text: Lithification follows closely on compaction, as increased temperatures at depth hasten the precipitation of cement that binds the grains together.
